testsuite.name: SDK initialiation
testsuite.details: SDK initialiation without list of placement

testcase.name: Check auto-cached placement ID
testcase.summary: Check auto-cached placement ID
testcase.preconditions: 1.Install vungle app.

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83] [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check for Auto-cached placement ID.
step.expectedresults:
1.All active placement id should be displayed on testapp as well as on config response which is associated with Pub APP ID.

2.Auto-cached placement id should be auto-cached /preload without tapping on load button.

testcase.name: Non Auto-cached Placement
testcase.summary: Check non auto-cached placement ID
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app.

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check for non Auto-cached placement ID.
step.expectedresults:
1.All active placement id should be displayed on testapp as well as on config response which is associated with Pub APP ID.

2.Placement id should not be autocached/preload.

testcase.name: One or zero auto-cached placement ID
testcase.summary: Check for one or zero auto-cached placement IDs form dashboard.
testcase.preconditions: Vungle app should be installed.

step.actions:
1.Create Pub ID from dashboard.

2.Check for one or zero Auto-cached placement ID.

3.Enter Pub App ID [i.e 5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

4.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

5.Initialise the SDK.
step.expectedresults:
1.If auto-cached checkbox is check, only one placement is should be selected as a auto-cached placement id.

2.If auto-cached checkbox is unchecked, no placement is should be auto-cached/preload.

testcase.name: Update Placement list
testcase.summary: Check updated placement list in SDK
testcase.preconditions:
1.Vungle app should be installed.
2.Update existing placement id name.

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub APP ID in app having updated placement id's and initialize the SDK.

2) Observe placement id name displayed in config response.
step.expectedresults: Updated placement ID's should get displayed in config response when SDK is initialized.

testcase.name: SDK initialise
testcase.summary: Check SDK initialise
testcase.preconditions: 1.Vungle app should be installed.

step.actions:
1) Enter valid Pub APP ID & End points

2)Tap on start button
step.expectedresults: 1) SDK should initialize successfully

testcase.name: Initialize the SDK with invalid pub app ID.
testcase.summary: Check invalid Pub App ID.
testcase.preconditions: 1.Vungle app should be installed.

step.actions:
1) Enter invalid Pub APP ID & End points

2)Tap on start button
step.expectedresults: User should not be able to initialise SDK with invalid Pub App ID.

testcase.name: Pub app ID having multiple placement ids.
testcase.summary: Check limitations of placement ids in Pub App ID.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Vungle app should be installed.

2.Pub app ID should have multiple placement ids when checked from dashboard.

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check for placement ids in Pub App ID. For Example:-Pub App ID having 30/40 placement ids.
step.expectedresults:
1.All active placement id should be displayed on testapp as well as on config response which is associated with Pub APP ID.

2.There should not be any limitation to displayed placement id's.

3.Every listed placement id should have ads associted with it.

testcase.name: Check 'auto_cached_check' parameter in config response
testcase.summary: Check 'auto_cached_check' parameter in config response.
testcase.preconditions: SDK version should be 5.1.0 or 5.1.0+

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check config response.
step.expectedresults:
1.'auto_cached_check' parameter should be present in config response.

2.By default 'auto_cached_check' parameter's value  should be 'false' in config response.

3.If 'auto_cached_check' parameter's value is 'true' then ad should get auto-cached/preload.

4.If 'auto_cached_check' parameter's value is 'false' then none of the placement should get auto-cached/preload.

testcase.name: Auto-Cache with more than one Placement
testcase.summary: Auto-Cache with more than one Placement
testcase.preconditions: App id should contain multiple placement id's

step.actions:
1. Manipulate auto-cache parameter as "True" for all placement id's in config response.
2. Initialize app
3. Observe Auto cache functionality
step.expectedresults:
1. All placement id's should load automatically.
2. Manual intervention should not be required to load ad.
3. Ad should get loaded automatically and user should be able to play ad

testcase.name: Ad Unit Caching for corresponding placement ID
testcase.summary: Check caching of  Ad for corresponding placement ID
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App Id.
2)Manually initialize the App
3)Tap on download button in front of placement ID for caching Ad to it.
4)Observe the Charles.
step.expectedresults:
1. Ad should download for corresponding placement ID.
2. Ad should play normally on device.

testcase.name: Placement ID serve the Ad or not
testcase.summary: Check placement id associated with entered Pub App id serve the Ad or not.
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App ID in TestApp.  
2)Initialize the App. 
3)Play the Ad.
step.expectedresults:
1.Associated Placement ID should serve the Ad.
2.Ad should play normally on TestApp with respect to the placement id for both platforms.

testcase.name: API Config request
testcase.summary: Check request payload of config API.
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App Id.
2)Manually initialise the App.
3)Observe request payload of config API in the charles Proxy.
step.expectedresults: Request payload of Config API should not contain Placement ID associated with Pub App Id.

testcase.name: Check response payload of config API
testcase.summary: To check response payload of config API
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App Id.
2)Manually initialize the SDK.
3)Observe response payload of config API in the charles Proxy.
step.expectedresults:
1) Response Status should : HTTP 200 OK in charles.  
2) Response Json file should contain the following field:- 
"api_endpoints","placement_info","config","will_play_ad","playback".
3) Response Json file should contain all the associated placement Id's list with Pub App Id.

testcase.name: Request payload of Ads API
testcase.summary: Check request payload of Ads API
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App Id.
2)Manually initialize the SDK.
3)Observe request payload of Ads API in the charles Proxy.
step.expectedresults:
Request Json should contain following field:- 
 "request info", "App info", 'device info" and 'system info",  "placements"

testcase.name: Response payload of Ads API
testcase.summary: To check response payload of Ads API
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App Id.
2)Manually initialize the SDK.
3)Observe response payload of RequestAd API in the charles Proxy
step.expectedresults:
1) Response Status should : HTTP 200 OK in charles.  
2) Response Json file should contain the following field for valid placement id:-"placement_reference_id", "ad_markup"
[id:,adType,campaign,callToActionUrl,countdown,showClose,cta_overlay,expiry ,app_id,showCloseIncentivized,delay,preBundle:,postBundle:,callToActionDest:,tpat:url:,videoWidth: ,videoHeight: ,md5:,size: ,chk:,retryCount: ,asyncThreshold: ,ad_token:,
video_object_id:,templateURL:,templateId:,templateFormat:,templateSettings:,info:,sleep]

testcase.name: Response payload of Ads API for both valid and Invalid Placement ID
testcase.summary: To check response payload of Ads API for both valid and Invalid Placement ID
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App Id
2)Manual initialise the App.
3)Observe response payload of Ads API in the charles Proxy for valid Placement ID's.
step.expectedresults:
1) Response Status should : HTTP 200 OK in charles for valid placement ID. 
2) Response Json file should contain the following field  for valid placement id;- 
"placement_reference_id", "ad_markup"[id:,adType,campaign,callToActionUrl,countdown,showClose,cta_overlay,expiry ,app_id,showCloseIncentivized,delay,preBundle:,postBundle:,callToActionDest:,tpat:url:,videoWidth: ,videoHeight: ,md5:,size: ,chk:,retryCount: ,asyncThreshold: ,ad_token:,
video_object_id:,templateURL:,templateId:,templateFormat:,templateSettings:,info:,sleep]

testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App Id.
2)Manually initialize the SDK.
3)Play the Ad and close the endcard.
4)Observe request payload of reportAd API in the charles Proxy.
step.expectedresults:
request payload of reportAd Json file should contain following fields:-  
"Application info","device info","placement_reference_id","incentivized","adDuration","ttDownload","campaign","adType","templateId","clickedThrough","system",

testcase.name: response payload of reportAd API
testcase.summary: To check response payload of reportAd API
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App Id.
2)Manually initialize the SDK.  
3)Play the Ad and close the endcard.
4)Observe request payload of reportAd API in the charles Proxy.
step.expectedresults: Response Status should : HTTP 200 OK in charles.

testcase.name: "Option" menu Page for incentivized/ non-incentivized
testcase.summary: Check incentivized/ non-incentivized Ad play normally on TestApp.
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App Id on TestApp.
2)Manually initialize the SDK.   
3)Play the Ad and click on close button.
4)Observe the functionality
step.expectedresults:
1. Incentivized/ non-incentivized Ad should play normally on TestApp.
2. User should able to customized Incentivized dialog box for rewarded placement ID.

testcase.name: "Option" menu Page for muted/ unmuted state.
testcase.summary: Check  Ad play normally on TestApp in muted/ unmuted state.
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App Id on TestApp.
2)Manually initialize the SDK.   
3)Turn on/off mute button.
4)Play the Ad 
5)Observe the audio of Video.
step.expectedresults:
1. Ad should play normally on TestApp in muted/ unmuted state.
2. Muted / unmuted settings for Placements also should be checked.

testcase.name: Ad cached for corresponding placement ID's
testcase.summary: To check  Ad cached for corresponding placement ID's
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub APP ID .
2)Manually initialize the App
3)Observe  the charles Proxy.
4)Open main screen of App.
5)Observe the placement ID's status after initialise.
step.expectedresults:
1)If Ad is cached for placement A , it should display checkmark  in front of placement A.
2) If Ad is not cached for placement A , it should display download mark  in front of placement A.

step.actions:
1)Enter pub APP.
2)Manually initialize the App.
3)Second page of app is open.
4)Tap on force download button in front of it.
5)Observe  the charles Proxy.
step.expectedresults: 1) Ad should cached for corresponding placement ID,  after tap on  play button Ad should play on device.

testcase.name: Status of placement ID's
testcase.summary: Check placement ID's Status on next page
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter pub app ID.
2)Manually initialize the App
3)Second page of app is open.
4)Observe the placement ID's status.
step.expectedresults: Only active Placement id will be displayed in the list with appropriate status.

testcase.name: Ad cached for only active placement ID's
testcase.summary: Check placement ID's Status on next page
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub APP ID.
2)Manually initialize the App
3)Observe  the charles Proxy after caching Ad's
step.expectedresults: SDK should download an Ad for the placement id when auto cache flag is enabled.

testcase.name: Placement Incentivized / non incentivized
testcase.summary: Check if Placement Incentivized / non incentivized is honored
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub APP ID.
2)Initialize the App and play the ad.
step.expectedresults:
1)The SDK should honor the Incentivized / non Incentivized setting
 
Example: if for a Placement id the ad is set to be incentivized, SDK should always play an incentivized Ad, and opposite for non Incentivized Ad
2)Observe incentivized flag value(0/1) in request payload of reportAd

testcase.name: Request Replacement Ad
testcase.summary: Check if SDK sends a Replacement Ad request after An Ad is played
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter pub app ID.
2)Initialize the App and Play Ad.
step.expectedresults:
1)After an Ad is played, the SDK should send an request to the AD server to get another AD for the Auto Cache placement ID.

2)If pub app doesnt have autocached placement then user should manually load the ad.

testcase.name: TPAT on placement
testcase.summary: Check Placement ID present or not in corresponding creative
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter pub App ID.
2)Manual initialize the App.
3)load ad & play full the Ad and close the end card/video.
4)Observe TPAT in the charles.
step.expectedresults:
When the SDK sends TPATs, they should include
i.e Placement Reference Id
about which placement the TPAT is for.
TPAT URL should match with the URL in the Request Ad API response.

testcase.name: Auto cached placement
testcase.summary: Check cached Ad is Played or not when user kill the app and reopen it
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub APP ID.
2)Manual initialize the App.
3)observe charles if ad is completely load
4)kill the app
5)re-open the app and initialize it
6)Play ad
step.expectedresults: SDK should play previous cached ad first

testcase.name: Load ad for placement
testcase.summary: Check when user tap on play ad button after initializing app the SDK should throw error message
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub APP ID.
2)Initialize the App.
3)Load the ad and play the ad.
4)Observe charles
step.expectedresults: Will play Ad should hit on charles when user tap on play button while downloading ads

testcase.name: Check creative delete from dis
testcase.summary: creatives be deleted from disk as soon as the ad was played and provided that there is no other valid placement at that point of time that maps to the same ad unit
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub App ID.
2)Initialize the App
3)note down "storage_bytes_available" parameter value from ads request.
4)Play the Ad
5)note down and compare "storage_bytes_available" parameter value from reportAd. with step 4
step.expectedresults: ReportAd's "storage_bytes_available" value should less than Ads request API

testcase.name: SDK callbacks
testcase.summary: Check SDK callbacks for loadAd
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install the app.

step.actions:
1)Initialize the App with Pub App ID.

2)Play the Ad

3)After playing the Ad 

4)Observe the listener callbacks for SDK callbacks for loadAd.
step.expectedresults:
Callbacks should display in listener callbacks on Test App.

Callbacks should display for every placement ID when user play Ad for it.

testcase.name: Callback for loadad request when SDK is in sleep state
testcase.summary: This test is to verify AND-808
testcase.preconditions:
SDK initiallized with more than one placement

Charles rewrite /api/v5/ads reponse with "sleep" reponse

{
    "ads": [{
        "placement_reference_id": "your placement ID goes here",
        "ad_markup": {
            "id": "",
            "campaign": null,
            "app_id": null,
            "sleep": 30,
            "info": "SDK sleeps for 30 sec",
            "delay": 0,
            "showClose": 0,
            "showCloseIncentivized": 0,
            "countdown": 0,
            "url": "",
            "videoWidth": 0,
            "videoHeight": 0
        }
    }]
}

step.actions:
1. Request loadad for a non-autocached placement (this would put the SDK to sleep)

2. While the SDK is in sleep state, request loadad for the same placement
step.expectedresults: Callback Output= onAdAvailabilityUpdate(placementReferenceId:, isAdAvailable: false)

testcase.name: Callback for explicit loadad request on an auto_cached placement when SDK is in sleep state
testcase.summary: This test to verify AND-808
testcase.preconditions:
SDK initiallized with more than one placement

Charles rewrite /api/v5/ads reponse with "sleep" reponse

{
    "ads": [{
        "placement_reference_id": "your placement ID goes here",
        "ad_markup": {
            "id": "",
            "campaign": null,
            "app_id": null,
            "sleep": 30,
            "info": "SDK sleeps for 30 sec",
            "delay": 0,
            "showClose": 0,
            "showCloseIncentivized": 0,
            "countdown": 0,
            "url": "",
            "videoWidth": 0,
            "videoHeight": 0
        }
    }]
}

step.actions: 1. While auto-cached placement is in sleep state. Tap the download button to request loadad
step.expectedresults: No callback message should be created

Charles rewrite /api/v5/ads reponse with "sleep" reponse

testcase.name: Split screen feature
testcase.summary: Check Ad plays normally when user use split screen feature during ad play.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Initialize the app.

2.Load the ad.

step.actions:
1.Play the ad.

2.Bring the App either  Full screen to split screen or split screen to full screen.
step.expectedresults: Ad shoud get play/pause when user bring the App either  Full screen to split screen or split screen to full screen.

testcase.name: Report Ad API after airplane mode
testcase.summary: Observe Report ad API in Charles after airplane mode
testcase.preconditions: Ad should get loaded

step.actions:
1) Initialise app 
2) Load ad
3) Turn on airplane/ flight mode
4) Play complete ad and close endcard
5) Turn off airplane mode and enable wifi
6) Observe Report Ad API in Charles
step.expectedresults: Report ad API should get generated for played ad after airplane mode is disabled and wifi gets connected to the network.

testcase.name: Auto Cached ad after airplane mode
testcase.summary: Auto-Cached placement Id after airplane mode
testcase.preconditions: Ad should be loaded

step.actions:
1) Initialise app 
2) Load ad
3) Turn on airplane/ flight mode
4) Play complete ad and close endcard
5) Turn off airplane mode and enable wifi
6) Observe Charles
step.expectedresults:
1) Auto-Cached placement Id should cache automatically
2) TPAT or other API calls/assets should get generated for played ad

testcase.name: User agent in API callls
testcase.summary: Presence of user agent in Vungle Endpoints for /new, /config, /ads, /will_play_ad, /report_ad, /ri
testcase.preconditions: 1.Install the app.

step.actions:
1. Initialise the app.

2. Enter pub app id.

3. Load ad.

4. Play ad.

5. Observer user agent in Config/new/ads/will_play_ad/Report Ad API
step.expectedresults:
1. Similar user agent should be present in all API call headers
2. User agent should be displayed in following format:

User-Agent : "VungleDroid/<sdk_version>"
Eg. User-Agent: VungleDroid/6.3.17

testcase.name: Check Store Kit Page
testcase.summary: Check StoreKit should properly opened after download link is clicked in Dynamic Template ads
testcase.preconditions: 1.Install the app

step.actions:
1. Initialise the app.

2. Enter pub app id.

3. Load & Play the Ad.

4.Tap on CTA button.

5.Tap on cancel button of storeKit.
step.expectedresults:
Legacy Ad:- User should redirect to App.

Mraid Ad:- User should redirect to App.

testcase.preconditions: 1.Install the app

step.actions: 1. Initialize app without Placement id

testcase.name: Incentivized pop when user lock/unlock device
testcase.summary: Verify incentivized ad when user lock/unlock device
testcase.preconditions: 1.Install the App.

step.actions:
1. Initialise the app.

2. Enter pub app id.

3. Load rewarded placement ID.

4. Play the ad.

5. Tap on Close button.

6. When incentivized pop up appears then Lock/Unlock device
step.expectedresults:

testcase.name: Configure placement id

2. Enter pub app id.

3. Select any placement id to configure.

4. Enter parameters to configure such as ordinal view, flex view , etc

step.expectedresults:

testcase.name: Verify video resumes if user visit testapp from appstore.
testcase.summary: Verify video resumes if user visit testapp from appstore.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.

2. initialize the app

step.actions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialize the app.
3. Load and Play Rewarded Legacy/Rewarded Mraid Ad.
4. Tap on CTA button during Adplay.
5. Revisit Testapp from appstore.
step.expectedresults:

2. For Legacy Ad, CTA button should disappear.

testcase.name: Parameters for request payload of ri API

2. Set ri enabled value true in request and map config file.  
3. Initialise the app.

1. Install the App and set charles Proxy.  
2. Enter the valid Placement id's.
3. Initialise the App.
4. Observe request payload parameter of ri API
step.expectedresults:
1. All parameters should displayed with it's value in request payload of ri.
2.Request payload should display following value.
"app": {...},
"device": {...},
"system": {...},
"request":{
"placement_reference_id":"REWARDE78811",
"adStartTime":1517012478,
"app_id":"$0$
{\"app_id\":\"5a57e2c45ccf1f44250129b8\",\"eventID\":\"5a6bbff587cf640be35187d1\"}
",
"user":"ggreg"
}

2. Set ri enabled value true in request and map config file.

3. Initialise the app.

testcase.name: ri enabled value is true in request payload of config.
testcase.summary: Check ri enabled value in request payload of config.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.

2. Set ri enabled value true in request and map config file.

3. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Install the App and set charles proxy.
2. Enter the valid Placement id's.
3. Initialise the App.
4. Observe the request payload of config API.
step.expectedresults:
If ri value is true in request payload of config then you see ri call when the Incentivized Ad has reached 75-80% of completion.

(ri API - https://events.api.vungle.com/api/v5/ri )

testcase.name: ri enabled value is false in request payload of config.
testcase.summary: Check ri enabled value in request payload of config.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.

2. Set ri enabled value false in request and map config file.

3. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Install the App and set charles Proxy.  
2. Enter the valid Placement id's.
3. Initialise the App.
4. Observe the request payload of config API
step.expectedresults: If ri value is false in request payload of config then you should not see ri call when the Ad has reached 75-80% of completion.

testcase.name: ri Api call for MRAID Ad
testcase.summary: Check ri API call for MRAID Ad
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.

2. Set ri enabled value true in request and map config file.

3. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Install the App and set charles Proxy.

testcase.name: Close button behavior for MRAID video
testcase.summary: Based on "INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" and "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" parameter value, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions:
1. Set Charles proxy.
  2. Initialise the App 
  3. play ad
  4. Observe the Charles.

step.actions: 1)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5", 2)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", 3)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", set thees value in Ads response API
step.expectedresults: 1) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is 5. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button. 2) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is skippable close button; otherwise, it should delay for 5 seconds. 3) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is 9999 which is skippable close button.. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button.

testcase.name: App not to be crash when it's in background

  2. Initialise the App

3)Play video and send to background. While playing the video, swipe down notifications, video should pause. Swipe back notifications, the video should now resume. Android: When the device's lock screen is set to none(Settings->Security->Screen lock none on Android devices), play video, off/lock the device, on/unlock the device again, the video should resume after the device is unlocked
step.expectedresults: The App shouldn't crash at any point

testcase.name: Broken point- when "MP4" assets are broken

​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1) Prepare broken asset (example, make simple text file ("brokenAsset.txt"), and rename it as "brokenAsset.mp4", and upload to local server.
2)Prepare "Ad" response with manipulated "url" to point to the asser you prepared in #1.
3)Start Test app
4)Map "Ad" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
5)Check if the SDK behaves accordingly
Test the same thing for "will_play_Ad" case
step.expectedresults: SDK keeps retrying for max of 6 times and the app should not crash.

testcase.name: Native Ad Flexview Close timer option.
testcase.summary: Manipulate Flexview Close timer parameter.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the app

4. Load and play the specific Ad.
step.expectedresults: Ad should stop/close at specified time.

step.actions:
1. Launch the test app.

2. Navigate to Placement Id's Configuration.

3. Set a Flexview close timer value as 20.

4. Load and play the specific Ad.

5. Tap on close button while playing the Ad before specified time(20).
step.expectedresults: Ad should close properly when tap on close button.

step.actions:
1. Launch the test app.

2. Navigate to Placement Id's Configuration.

3. Set a Flexview close timer value greater than '0' eg. 2/4/15.

4. Load and play the specific Ad.
step.expectedresults: Ad should stop/close at specified time.

testcase.name: Flexview Ad Close timer option
testcase.summary: Check for the adDuration parameter of Flexview ad.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.

​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1. Install the App.

2. Initialise the App.

3. Configure flexview close timer value(Eg. 20 sec) in flexview ad.

4. Load and play ad.

5. Lock the device before flexview close timer value(Eg. 10 sec).

6. Unlock the device after flexview close timer value (Eg. 25 sec).

7. Observe the request payload of report ad.
step.expectedresults:
1. All the parameter of the request payload should contain specified value associated with it. (adDuration, videoViewed)

2. None of the parameter of the should contain negative or '0' value.(Ad duration, videoViewed).

1) Enter valid Pub APP ID & End points

2)Tap on start button
step.expectedresults: 1) SDK should initialize successfully

testcase.name: Initialize the SDK with invalid pub app ID.
testcase.summary: Check invalid Pub App ID.
testcase.preconditions: 1.Vungle app should be installed.

step.actions:
1) Enter invalid Pub APP ID & End points

2)Tap on start button
step.expectedresults: User should not be able to initialise SDK with invalid Pub App ID.

testcase.name: Pub app ID having multiple placement ids.
testcase.summary: Check limitations of placement ids in Pub App ID.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Vungle app should be installed.

2.Pub app ID should have multiple placement ids when checked from dashboard.

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check for placement ids in Pub App ID. For Example:-Pub App ID having 30/40 placement ids.
step.expectedresults:
1.All active placement id should be displayed on testapp as well as on config response which is associated with Pub APP ID.

2.There should not be any limitation to displayed placement id's.

3.Every listed placement id should have ads associted with it.

testcase.name: Check 'auto_cached_check' parameter in config response
testcase.summary: Check 'auto_cached_check' parameter in config response.
testcase.preconditions: SDK version should be 5.1.0 or 5.1.0+

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check config response.
step.expectedresults:
1.'auto_cached_check' parameter should be present in config response.

2.By default 'auto_cached_check' parameter's value  should be 'false' in config response.

3.If 'auto_cached_check' parameter's value is 'true' then ad should get auto-cached/preload.

4.If 'auto_cached_check' parameter's value is 'false' then none of the placement should get auto-cached/preload.

testcase.name: Auto-Cache with more than one Placement
testcase.summary: Auto-Cache with more than one Placement
testcase.preconditions: App id should contain multiple placement id's

step.actions:
1. Manipulate auto-cache parameter as "True" for all placement id's in config response.
2. Initialize app
3. Observe Auto cache functionality
step.expectedresults:
1. All placement id's should load automatically.
2. Manual intervention should not be required to load ad.
3. Ad should get loaded automatically and user should be able to play ad

testcase.name: Kill the app while multi auto-cache is loading
testcase.summary: To verify Kill the app while multi auto-cache is loading
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install App
2. Initialize app

step.actions:
1. Initialize the app
2. Kill the app while the auto-caching is loading
3. Re-initialize the app
step.expectedresults:
auto-caching must be paused when the app is killed
App should resume auto-caching only that have not been auto-cached when the app is killed.

testcase.name: App initializing
testcase.summary: Check response in charles after App initialize
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the app

step.actions:
1)Install the App on iOS device and set charles Proxy.  
2)Enter the Placement id's.
3)Initialize the SDK.
4)Observe the charles.
step.expectedresults:
1. App should get initialized.
  2. Config API should get called.
  3. SDK should download an Ad for the placement id when auto cache flag is enabled.

testcase.name: Ad Unit Caching
testcase.summary: Check caching of multiple Ad's
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the app

step.actions:
1)Install the App on iOS device and set charles Proxy.  
2)Enter the Placement id's.
3)Initialize the SDK.
4)Observe the charles. 
5)Play the Ads.
6)Repeat 3,4,5
step.expectedresults:
1) SDK should download multiple Ads for all placement id's with respect to placement priority. 
2) If 2 Placements have the same Metadata the Ad should not be downloaded twice.
3) If an Ad is already downloaded and if the App tries to download an Ad with same meta data, the SDK should use the Cached Ad and not download again.
4) Based on the Auto Cache Flag in the test app, The ad for the particular placement id will be downloaded automatically.
 
Note:- 
This will happen only when Metadata for 2 Ad's is the same

video_object_id:,templateURL:,templateId:,templateFormat:,templateSettings:,info:,sleep]

testcase.name: Ad cached for corresponding placement ID's
testcase.summary: To check  Ad cached for corresponding placement ID's
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the

step.actions:

2)Enter Pub App Id.
3)Manually initialize the App
4)Observe  the charles Proxy.

Same for remaining ID's.

step.actions:
)Install the App on Android device and set charles Proxy.  
2)Enter Pub App Id.
3)Manually initialize the App
4)Observe the placement ID's status.
5)If  Ad is not cached for any placement ID's , tap on force download button in front of it.

step.expectedresults:
1) Ad should cached for corresponding placement ID,  after tap on  play button Ad should play on device.
2) If incase Ad is not cached for corresponding placement ID,  after taping play button streaming Ad should play on device.

testcase.name: Callback for loadad request when SDK is in sleep state
testcase.summary: This test is to verify AND-808
testcase.preconditions:
SDK initiallized with more than one placement

Charles rewrite /api/v5/ads reponse with "sleep" reponse

{
    "ads": [{
        "placement_reference_id": "your placement ID goes here",
        "ad_markup": {
            "id": "",
            "campaign": null,
            "app_id": null,
            "sleep": 30,
            "info": "SDK sleeps for 30 sec",
            "delay": 0,
            "showClose": 0,
            "showCloseIncentivized": 0,
            "countdown": 0,
            "url": "",
            "videoWidth": 0,
            "videoHeight": 0
        }
    }]
}

step.actions:
1. Request loadad for a non-autocached placement (this would put the SDK to sleep)

2. While the SDK is in sleep state, request loadad for the same placement
step.expectedresults: Callback Output= onAdAvailabilityUpdate(placementReferenceId:, isAdAvailable: false)

{

testcase.name: Manipulate the "sleep" parameter value in response of ads
testcase.summary: check Manipulate the "sleep" parameter value in response of ads
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the app

step.actions:
1) Map ads response with sleep response.
2) Initialize app
3) Observe Ads API call in Charles
step.expectedresults: The SDK should wait the amount of sleep seconds specified by the server

step.actions:
Enter:
AppID: 595d73ee3087f51025000040
Placements: DEFAULT63909, GOSLEEP27738, MRAID0058210
 
Steps:
1. Launch the test app
2. LoadAd for sleep placement id (this gets sleep response)
3. LoadAd for sleep placement id
step.expectedresults:
1) Sleep on ads response should affect only on the specific placement for that duration.
2) Except the Placement that got sleep, SDK should be able to prepare ads for other Placements.
3) For any sleep response SDK should return Ad Unavailable for that Placement.
4) Sleep for auto cached ads on expiration, should resume preparation of ad.
5) Sleep for non auto cached ad should not resume preparation of ad automatically.
6) On context switching to other apps, or even in case of forced stop or kill the app, on resuming or re initialisation of SDK should Honor any existing sleep for Placements.

step.actions:
1) Map ads response with sleep response.
2) Initialize app
3) Observe Ads API call in Charles.
4)Sleep responce is recive.
5)After this remove map ads response.
6)Observe the charles fopr ads response.
step.expectedresults:
1)Sleep for auto cached ads on expiration, should resume preparation of ad

2)Vaild ads response should recive and ad should play normally.

testcase.name: Close button behavior for MRAID video
testcase.summary: Based on "INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" and "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" parameter value, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions:
1. Set Charles proxy.
  2. Initialise the App 
  3. play ad
  4. Observe the Charles.

step.actions: 1)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5", 2)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", 3)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", set thees value in Ads response API
step.expectedresults: 1) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is 5. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button. 2) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is skippable close button; otherwise, it should delay for 5 seconds. 3) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is 9999 which is skippable close button.. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button.

  2. Start Test app

  4. Check if the SDK behaves
step.expectedresults: The SDK should give up downloading the ad asset. The SDK should try to send "requestAd" again.

testcase.name: App not to be crash when it's in background
testcase.summary: Check for An app shouldn't crash while in the background
testcase.preconditions:
1. Set Charles proxy.
  2. Initialise the App

step.actions:
1) Start Test app Init SDK and play an ad

2)Send app to the background for 5 minutes

3)Play video and send to background. While playing the video, swipe down notifications, video should pause. Swipe back notifications, the video should now resume. Android: When the device's lock screen is set to none(Settings->Security->Screen lock none on Android devices), play video, off/lock the device, on/unlock the device again, the video should resume after the device is unlocked
step.expectedresults: The App shouldn't crash at any point

testcase.name: Headers

  2. Initialise the App 
  3. play ad
  4. Observe the Charles

step.actions:
1. Initialise the App
  2. Play the Ad
  3. Check API call header with Charles Proxy
step.expectedresults:
SDK version

For Version 5.0 header should be "Vungle-Version: 5"

For Version 5.1 header should be "Vungle-Version: 5.1.x"

"User-Agent" should be included in HTTP header with valid data

testcase.name: CallToActionurl fired for MRAID Ads in Charles.
testcase.summary: Verify  CallToActionurl fired for Legacy Ads in Charles.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.

2. Initialise the app.

MRAID Ads:

1. "callToActionDest": "https://cdnspdl.arkofwar.com/download/ark/infinitywar-alipay-release.apk",
2. "callToActionUrl": "https://app.appsflyer.com/com.tap4fun.brutalage_test?pid=vunglecnandroid&c=2&af_r=http://ba-marking.tridentstudio.cn/ba/without_text/2/index.html"
3. "CTA_BUTTON_URL": "https://cdnspdl.arkofwar.com/download/ark/infinitywar-alipay-release.apk"

step.actions:
1. Change the 'callToActionurl', 'callToActiondest', 'CTA_BUTTON_URL' parameter value in response payload of Ads API.

2. Map the Mraid Ad response.

3. Initialise the app.

4. Load and Play Mraid Ad.

5. Tap on the Download button during Adplay or on End card.

6. Observe Clickurl, PostrollClick and callToActionurl fire in charles.
step.expectedresults:
1. Postrollclick should get fire in Charles.

2. CallToActionurl and click url should get fired in charles after postrollclick TPAT.

4)Ad volume change 2  - not change

6)Ad end - muted

testsuite.name: Malformed , breakpoints , null and invalid video

testcase.name: Invalid video
testcase.summary: Check if the SDK behave as expected when an video asset is broken
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1)Prepare "Ad" response with changing "url" point to broken video file
2)Init SDK and play an ad
3)Test with invalid Vungle MRAID video
4)Test with invalidThirdpartystreamingvideo
step.expectedresults: Invalid video should not crash the SDK. The video should be skipped and only end card is shown

testcase.name: Broken point- when "MP4" assets are broken
testcase.summary: Check how the SDK should try to send "Ad" again, when "MP4" assets are broken.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1) Prepare broken asset (example, make simple text file ("brokenAsset.txt"), and rename it as "brokenAsset.mp4", and upload to local server.
2)Prepare "Ad" response with manipulated "url" to point to the asser you prepared in #1.
3)Start Test app
4)Map "Ad" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
5)Check if the SDK behaves accordingly
Test the same thing for "will_play_Ad" case
step.expectedresults: SDK keeps retrying for max of 6 times and the app should not crash.

testcase.name: Broken point-when "end card zip" assets are broken
testcase.summary: Check how the SDK should try to send "Ads" again, when "end card zip" assets are broken, and restart app before playing it.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1) Prepare broken asset (example, make simple text file ("brokenAsset.txt"), and rename it as "brokenAsset.zip", and upload to local server.
2)Prepare "Ads" response with manipulated "url" to point to the asser you prepared in #1.
3)Start Test app
4)Map "Ad" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
5)Check if the SDK behaves accordingly
Test the same thing for "will_play_Ad" case
step.expectedresults: SDK keeps retrying for max of 6 times and the app should not crash.

testcase.name: Broken point -"MRAID font" assets are broken
testcase.summary: Check how the SDK should try to send "Ad" again, when "MRAID font" assets are broken.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1) Prepare broken asset (example, make simple text file ("brokenAsset.txt"), and rename it as "MRAID font", and upload to local server.
2)Prepare "Ads" response with manipulated "url" to point to the asser you prepared in #1.
3)Start Test app
4)Map "Ad" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
5)Check if the SDK behaves accordingly
Test the same thing for "will_play_Ad" case
step.expectedresults: SDK keeps retrying for max of 6 times and the app should not crash

testcase.name: Malformed contains null for every value in the JSON object.
testcase.summary: Verify SDK behavior when it gets a JSON response from requestAd endpoint that contains null for every value in the JSON object.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1)Prepare "malformed" response
2)Start Test app
3)Map "requestAd" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return a /requestAd response that contains null for every value.
4)Check the SDK behaves accordingly
step.expectedresults: The SDK should keep retrying requesting Ads until a valid request is retrieved

testcase.name: Broken point-when outgoing store requests gets stuck after tapping on download button.
testcase.summary: Check how the SDK should behave as expected when outgoing store requests gets stuck after tapping on download button on end card
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1)Start Test app
2)Play an ad and go to end card
3)Tap on "download" button
4)With using Charles "break points" to block "outgoing store requests"
Test the same thing for "requestStreamingAd" case
Test the same thing for MRAID cas
step.expectedresults:
Breaking on the outgoing url will not affect the app,
its just that the outgoing url will not open in the browser,
if we go back to the app it will be at the home screen.

testcase.name: Malformed JSON
testcase.summary: Check if SDK behaves accordingly when it gets malformed response from "config" API call
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1)Prepare "malformed" response (invalid JSON)
2)Start Test app
3)Map "config" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return malformed response
4)Check the SDK behaves accordingly
step.expectedresults: SDK should not crash and should keep retrying to get a valid config. The SDK should be able to play Ads.

testcase.name: Malformed JSON response from Ad endpoint that contains empty string
testcase.summary: Verify SDK behavior when it gets a JSON response from Ad endpoint that contains empty string ("") for every value in the JSON object.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1)Prepare an JSON response.
2)Map /requestStreamingAd API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return a response with empty string in all of it's values (take a /requestAd response and set empty string "" for all the values).
3)Start Test App
4)Allow the test App to request an Ad
Test case same as for will_play_ad.
step.expectedresults: The SDK should play a cached Ad (for any adTypes: local, MRAID, third party)

testcase.name: Invalid Response from "config" API call includes Null values
testcase.summary: Check if SDK behaves accordingly when the response from "config" API call includes Null values
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1)Prepare an JSON response.
2)Start Test App
3)Map "config" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return response with Null values
4)Check the SDK behaves accordingly
step.expectedresults: SDK should not crash and should keep retrying to get a valid config. The SDK should be able to play Ads.

testcase.name: Invalid Response from "Ad" API call includes Null values
testcase.summary: Check if SDK behaves accordingly when the response from "Ad" API call includes Null values

testcase.name: Verify 'Add in Flexfeed' option in Configure placement for Flexfeed Ad.

2. Initialize the app.

step.expectedresults:

testcase.name: Verify 'remove from Flexfeed' option in configure of the Flexfeed placement.

3. Tap on Configure option of the Flexfeed placement.

4. Tap on remove from Flexfeed option in placement configuration.

5. Go to the Flexfeed mode of the app.
step.expectedresults:
1. Removed Flexfeed placement Id should not shown in the Flexfeed mode.

2. User should be able to Add and remove Flexfeed placement Id from configure option.

testcase.name: Flexview Ad Close timer option
testcase.summary: Check for the adDuration parameter of Flexview ad.

1.Install the App.

​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1. Install the App.

2. Initialise the App.

3. Configure flexview close timer value(Eg. 20 sec) in flexview ad.

4. Load and play ad.

5. Lock the device before flexview close timer value(Eg. 10 sec).

6. Unlock the device after flexview close timer value (Eg. 25 sec).

7. Observe the request payload of report ad.
step.expectedresults:
1. All the parameter of the request payload should contain specified value associated with it. (adDuration, videoViewed)

2. None of the parameter of the should contain negative or '0' value.(Ad duration, videoViewed).

testcase.name: Enable MOAT SDK
testcase.summary: MOAT SDK Can be endabled/disabled by the server via /config response.
testcase.preconditions:
Rewrite /config reponse with

    "viewability": {
        "moat": true
    },

step.actions:
1.Install the App.
2.Enter Pub APP ID &  placement ID for Exchange Ads.
3.Initialize the App.
4.Play the Ad.
5.Observe the Config API.
step.expectedresults:
In Charles log, you should see CONNECT z.moatads.com

MOAT tracker should enable for SDK

MOAT should track the viewability of video in TPAT and reportAd.

testcase.name: Disable MOAT SDK

testcase.name: Test Invalid VAST
testcase.summary: Check if SDK behaves accordingly when we malform response of "ads" API call.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the app.

2.Initialize the app.

step.actions:
1. Prepare malformed response as

"moat": {

     "is_enabled": false,
     "extra_vast": ""

2.Start Test app.

3.Map "ads" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return malformed response.

4.Check SDK behaves accordingly.
step.expectedresults: SDK should not crash & should keep retrying to get valid ads.The SDK should be able to play ads.

testcase.name: I consent popup
testcase.summary: Check for the I consent popup appearance.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialize the app.

step.actions:
1. Install the app.
2. Manipulate 'is_country_data_protected": true' in response payload of config API.
3. Initialize the app.
4. Load and Play Ad.
5. Observe the Consent popup.
step.expectedresults:
1. Consent popup should appear on video when user plays an ad.
2. Consent popup should not disappear unless user selects either of the option.
3. Consent popup should contain proper Default values without any truncation issue and spelling mistake issue.

testcase.name: To check ordinal data parameter in report ad.
testcase.summary: Check ordinal view data count .
testcase.preconditions:

step.actions:

  2. Tap on configure placement ad.
  3. Set ordinal view data count as eg. 0/alphabets/special characters.
  4. Load and Play ad and observe charles.

1. Tap on placement id of flexview ad.
  2. Tap on configure placement ad.

step.expectedresults: "Ordinal count" should  display configured value in reportAd.

testcase.name: Check "apk_direct_download" is enabled option.
testcase.summary: Check if SDK behaves correctly when "apk_direct_download" is enabled.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialize the app.

step.actions:
1. Initialize the app.
2. Legacy Placement id - Configure
3. Check "Enable direct download apk" option
4. Manipulate "callToActionDest" and "callToActionUrl to an apk url or landing page ur in ads API.
E.G. https://cdnspdl.arkofwar.com/download/ark/infinitywar-alipay-release.apk
https://app.appsflyer.com/com.tap4fun.brutalage_test?pid=vunglecnandroid&c=2&af_r=http://ba-marking.tridentstudio.cn/ba/without_text/2/index.html
5. Manipulate "requires_sideloading" to "true" in config API
6. Load ad and play ad.
step.expectedresults:
1..if it's landing page url, open webview inside sDK for landing page, user can click the download button to download.
2..if it's apk url, SDK will initilize apk download.
3.if it's apk url or landing page url, download should pause in cellular environment, and resume in WIFI environment.

testcase.name: Availability of passing "is_google_play_services_available" to server
testcase.summary: Check correctness of sending "is_google_play_services_available" to server
testcase.preconditions:
1. Use two devices: one has google play installed, the other one does NOT have installed google play.
2. Install the app on two devices.
3. Initialize the app.
4. Charles is ready.

step.actions:
1. Load ad.
2. Play ad.
3. Check all requests' body(ads/ willplayad/ config/ etc) from Charles.
step.expectedresults:
1. For device which has google play installed, the "is_google_play_services_available" should be true.
2. For device which does NOT have google play installed, the "is_google_play_services_available" should be false.

testcase.name: Availability of "should_transmit_imei"
testcase.summary:
should_transmit_imei is true.
Publisher set imei.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app
2. Initialize the app.
3. Charles is ready.
4. Mock config response and set "attribution_reporting": {
"should_transmit_imei": true
}
5. Mock ads response and set "postroll_click" to below format:
https://app.appsflyer.com/com.vungle.games.tossacoin?pid=vungle_int&eid=afebdfas&imei=%imei%
(Contains "%imei%" in TPAT url)

step.actions:
1.Test app set IMEI
2. Load ad.
3. Play ad.
4. Click end card after ad finishes playing.
5. Check TPAT url from charles
step.expectedresults:
The TPAT url is changed. %imei% should be replaced by IMEI string.
Eg. "https://app.appsflyer.com/com.vungle.games.tossacoin?pid=vungle_int&eid=afebdfas&imei=7849931029472912".

testcase.summary: Load/play Ad on WiFi and load next ad on Data Network
testcase.preconditions:
ADB tool is ready
adb commands:
- WiFi: adb shell svc wifi enable/disable
- Data Network: adb shell svc data enable/disable

step.actions:
1. Enable WiFi
2. Initialize the app
3. Load one ad and play
4. Switch to Data Network
5. Load the same Ad
step.expectedresults:
Ad loading should be successful
All assets should be loaded with Status 200

testcase.name: Load/play Ad on Data Network and load next ad on WiFi
testcase.summary: Load/play Ad on Data Network and load next ad on WiFi
testcase.preconditions:
ADB tool is ready
adb commands:
- WiFi: adb shell svc wifi enable/disable
- Data Network: adb shell svc data enable/disable

step.actions:
1. Enable Data Network
2. Initialize the app
3. Load one ad and play
4. Switch to WiFi
5. Load the same ad
step.expectedresults:
Ad loading should be successful
All assets should be loaded with Status 200

testcase.name: Kill the app while assets are downloading
testcase.summary: Kill the app while assets are downloading
testcase.preconditions:
The device is connected to Charles
Set Throttle with low bandwidth of network to download asset slowly

step.actions:
1. Download assets
2. Kill the test app while an asset is downloading
3. Launch and re-initialize the test app
4. Turn off Throttle on Charles to speed up the asset download
step.expectedresults:
Ad loading should be successful
All assets should start to load with Status 200
When the app is relaunched, the interrupted assets should be loaded partially with Status 206
The ad must be playable after the re-load is completed

Auto-Cacheable AD: SDK triggers re-downloading automatically
Non Auto-Cacheable AD: SDK doesn't trigger re-downloading. when the load ad is triggered manually, it starts re-downloading

testcase.name: Put the app in background while assets are downloading
testcase.summary: put the app in background while assets are downloading
testcase.preconditions:
The device is connected to Charles
Set Throttle with low bandwidth of network to download asset slowly

step.actions:
1. Initialize the app
2. Download the ads
3. Put the app in background
step.expectedresults:
Ad loading continues on while the app stays in background.
When the app is in foreground, the ad should be playable.

testcase.name: WiFi to Data Network
testcase.summary: WiFi to Data Network
testcase.preconditions:
The device has both WiFi and Data Network enabled
The device is connected to Charles
Set Throttle with low bandwidth of network to download asset slowly

adb commands:
- WiFi: adb shell svc wifi enable/disable
- Data Network: adb shell svc data enable/disable

step.actions:
1. download assets on WiFi Network
2. disable WiFi network while assets are downloading
3. Observe the data network is enabled
step.expectedresults:
Ad loading should be successful
Ad should be playable

testcase.name: Data network to WiFi
testcase.summary: Data network to WiFi
testcase.preconditions:
The device has both WiFi and Data Network enabled
The device is connected to Charles
Set Throttle with low bandwidth of network to download asset slowly

adb commands:
- WiFi: adb shell svc wifi enable/disable
- Data Network: adb shell svc data enable/disable

step.actions:
1. Download assets on Data Network
2. Disable Data network by adb command while assets are downloading
3. Observe WiFi network is enabled
step.expectedresults:
Ad loading should be successful
Ad should be playable

testcase.name: WiFi AP Handoff AP1 <-> AP2
testcase.summary:
WiFi AP Handoff
AP1 <-> AP2

step.actions:
1. Download assets
2. Disable WiFi network by turning off WiFi AP1
3. WiFi AP2 is enabled
4. Enable WiFi AP1 less than 1s after turning off WiFi AP1
5. WiFi AP1 is enabled
4. Try step2 and step5 multiple times while the assets are downloading
step.expectedresults:
Ad loading should be successful
Ad should be playable

testcase.name: Low to High Bandwidth Transition low bandwidth (3G, 1x) -> back to high bandwidth
testcase.summary:
Low to High Bandwidth Transition
low bandwidth (3G, 1x) -> back to high bandwidth

step.actions:
1. Set Throttle preset to low bandwidth
2. Download assets
3. Set Throttle preset to high bandwidth (4G) while the assets are downloading
step.expectedresults:
Ad loading should be successful
Ad should be playable

testsuite.name: SDK initialiation
testsuite.details: SDK initialiation without list of placement

testcase.name: Check auto-cached placement ID
testcase.summary: Check auto-cached placement ID
testcase.preconditions: 1.Install vungle app.

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83] [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check for Auto-cached placement ID.
step.expectedresults:
1.All active placement id should be displayed on testapp as well as on config response which is associated with Pub APP ID.

2.Auto-cached placement id should be auto-cached /preload without tapping on load button.

testcase.name: Non Auto-cached Placement
testcase.summary: Check non auto-cached placement ID
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app.

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check for non Auto-cached placement ID.
step.expectedresults:

2.Placement id should not be autocached/preload.

testcase.name: One or zero auto-cached placement ID
testcase.summary: Check for one or zero auto-cached placement IDs form dashboard.
testcase.preconditions: Vungle app should be installed.

step.actions:
1.Create Pub ID from dashboard.

2.Check for one or zero Auto-cached placement ID.

3.Enter Pub App ID [i.e 5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

4.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

5.Initialise the SDK.
step.expectedresults:
1.If auto-cached checkbox is check, only one placement is should be selected as a auto-cached placement id.

2.If auto-cached checkbox is unchecked, no placement is should be auto-cached/preload.

testcase.name: Update Placement list
testcase.summary: Check updated placement list in SDK
testcase.preconditions:
1.Vungle app should be installed.
2.Update existing placement id name.

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub APP ID in app having updated placement id's and initialize the SDK.

2) Observe placement id name displayed in config response.
step.expectedresults: Updated placement ID's should get displayed in config response when SDK is initialized.

testcase.name: SDK initialise
testcase.summary: Check SDK initialise

step.actions:
1) Enter valid Pub APP ID & End points

2)Tap on start button
step.expectedresults: 1) SDK should initialize successfully

testcase.summary: Check invalid Pub App ID.
testcase.preconditions: 1.Vungle app should be installed.

step.actions:
1) Enter invalid Pub APP ID & End points

2)Tap on start button
step.expectedresults: User should not be able to initialise SDK with invalid Pub App ID.

testcase.name: Pub app ID having multiple placement ids.
testcase.summary: Check limitations of placement ids in Pub App ID.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Vungle app should be installed.

2.Pub app ID should have multiple placement ids when checked from dashboard.

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check for placement ids in Pub App ID. For Example:-Pub App ID having 30/40 placement ids.
step.expectedresults:
1.All active placement id should be displayed on testapp as well as on config response which is associated with Pub APP ID.

2.There should not be any limitation to displayed placement id's.

3.Every listed placement id should have ads associted with it.

testcase.name: Check 'auto_cached_check' parameter in config response
testcase.summary: Check 'auto_cached_check' parameter in config response.
testcase.preconditions: SDK version should be 5.1.0 or 5.1.0+

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check config response.
step.expectedresults:
1.'auto_cached_check' parameter should be present in config response.

2.By default 'auto_cached_check' parameter's value  should be 'false' in config response.

3.If 'auto_cached_check' parameter's value is 'true' then ad should get auto-cached/preload.

4.If 'auto_cached_check' parameter's value is 'false' then none of the placement should get auto-cached/preload.

testcase.name: Auto-Cache with more than one Placement
testcase.summary: Auto-Cache with more than one Placement

step.actions:

2. Initialize app
3. Observe Auto cache functionality
step.expectedresults:
1. All placement id's should load automatically.
2. Manual intervention should not be required to load ad.
3. Ad should get loaded automatically and user should be able to play ad

1. Install app 
2. Initialize the

step.actions:
)Install the App on Windows device and set charles Proxy.

testcase.name: view discrepancy
testcase.summary: Check and compare eventID in response of rquestAd and reportAd

7)Reopen the App and play the Ad.
8)Observe the eventID in reportAd.

1) before killing App eventID should same in  response of requestAd and reportAd.

testcase.name: Manipulate the "sleep" parameter value in response of ads
testcase.summary: check Manipulate the "sleep" parameter value in response of ads
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the app

step.actions:
1) Map ads response with sleep response.
2) Initialize app
3) Observe Ads API call in Charles
step.expectedresults: The SDK should wait the amount of sleep seconds specified by the server

step.actions:
Enter:
AppID: 595d73ee3087f51025000040
Placements: DEFAULT63909, GOSLEEP27738, MRAID0058210
 
Steps:
1. Launch the test app
2. LoadAd for sleep placement id (this gets sleep response)
3. LoadAd for sleep placement id
step.expectedresults: User should not be able to LoadAd if  SDK receive sleep response from the previous LoadAd request

step.actions:
Enter:
AppID: 595d73ee3087f51025000040
Placements: DEFAULT63909, GOSLEEP27738, MRAID0058210
 
Steps:
1. Launch the test app
2. LoadAd for sleep placement id (this gets sleep response)
3. LoadAd for sleep placement id
step.expectedresults:
1) Sleep on ads response should affect only on the specific placement for that duration.
2) Except the Placement that got sleep, SDK should be able to prepare ads for other Placements.
3) For any sleep response SDK should return Ad Unavailable for that Placement.
4) Sleep for auto cached ads on expiration, should resume preparation of ad.
5) Sleep for non auto cached ad should not resume preparation of ad automatically.
6) On context switching to other apps, or even in case of forced stop or kill the app, on resuming or re initialisation of SDK should Honor any existing sleep for Placements.

testsuite.name: Malformed , breakpoints , null and invalid video

testcase.name: Invalid video
testcase.summary: Check if the SDK behave as expected when an video asset is broken
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1)Prepare "Ad" response with changing "url" point to broken video file
2)Init SDK and play an ad
3)Test with invalid Vungle MRAID video
4)Test with invalidThirdpartystreamingvideo
step.expectedresults: Invalid video should not crash the SDK. The video should be skipped and only end card is shown

testcase.name: Broken point- when "MP4" assets are broken
testcase.summary: Check how the SDK should try to send "Ad" again, when "MP4" assets are broken.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1) Prepare broken asset (example, make simple text file ("brokenAsset.txt"), and rename it as "brokenAsset.mp4", and upload to local server.
2)Prepare "Ad" response with manipulated "url" to point to the asser you prepared in #1.
3)Start Test app
4)Map "Ad" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
5)Check if the SDK behaves accordingly
Test the same thing for "will_play_Ad" case
step.expectedresults: SDK keeps retrying for max of 6 times and the app should not crash.

testcase.name: Broken point-when "end card zip" assets are broken
testcase.summary: Check how the SDK should try to send "Ads" again, when "end card zip" assets are broken, and restart app before playing it.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1) Prepare broken asset (example, make simple text file ("brokenAsset.txt"), and rename it as "brokenAsset.zip", and upload to local server.
2)Prepare "Ads" response with manipulated "url" to point to the asser you prepared in #1.
3)Start Test app
4)Map "Ad" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
5)Check if the SDK behaves accordingly
Test the same thing for "will_play_Ad" case
step.expectedresults: SDK keeps retrying for max of 6 times and the app should not crash.

testcase.name: Broken point -"MRAID font" assets are broken
testcase.summary: Check how the SDK should try to send "Ad" again, when "MRAID font" assets are broken.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1) Prepare broken asset (example, make simple text file ("brokenAsset.txt"), and rename it as "MRAID font", and upload to local server.
2)Prepare "Ads" response with manipulated "url" to point to the asser you prepared in #1.
3)Start Test app
4)Map "Ad" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
5)Check if the SDK behaves accordingly
Test the same thing for "will_play_Ad" case
step.expectedresults: SDK keeps retrying for max of 6 times and the app should not crash

testcase.name: Broken point-when outgoing store requests gets stuck after tapping on download button.
testcase.summary: Check how the SDK should behave as expected when outgoing store requests gets stuck after tapping on download button on end card
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1)Start Test app
2)Play an ad and go to end card
3)Tap on "download" button
4)With using Charles "break points" to block "outgoing store requests"
Test the same thing for "requestStreamingAd" case
Test the same thing for MRAID cas
step.expectedresults:
Breaking on the outgoing url will not affect the app,
its just that the outgoing url will not open in the browser,
if we go back to the app it will be at the home screen.

testcase.name: Malformed JSON
testcase.summary: Check if SDK behaves accordingly when it gets malformed response from "config" API call
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1)Prepare "malformed" response (invalid JSON)
2)Start Test app
3)Map "config" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return malformed response
4)Check the SDK behaves accordingly
step.expectedresults: SDK should not crash and should keep retrying to get a valid config. The SDK should be able to play Ads.

testcase.name: Malformed contains null for every value in the JSON object.
testcase.summary: Verify SDK behavior when it gets a JSON response from requestAd endpoint that contains null for every value in the JSON object.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.
​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1)Prepare "malformed" response
2)Start Test app
3)Map "requestAd" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return a /requestAd response that contains null for every value.
4)Check the SDK behaves accordingly
step.expectedresults: The SDK should keep retrying requesting Ads until a valid request is retrieved

testcase.name: Invalid Response from "config" API call includes Null values

4)Check the SDK behaves accordingly
step.expectedresults: SDK should not crash and should keep retrying to get a valid config. The SDK should be able to play Ads.

testcase.name: Flexview Ad Close timer option
testcase.summary: Check for the adDuration parameter of Flexview ad.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.

​2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1. Install the App.

2. Initialise the App.

3. Configure flexview close timer value(Eg. 20 sec) in flexview ad.

4. Load and play ad.

5. Lock the device before flexview close timer value(Eg. 10 sec).

6. Unlock the device after flexview close timer value (Eg. 25 sec).

7. Observe the request payload of report ad.
step.expectedresults:
1. All the parameter of the request payload should contain specified value associated with it. (adDuration, videoViewed)

2. None of the parameter of the should contain negative or '0' value.(Ad duration, videoViewed).

testcase.name: Test App freeze

testcase.name: To Check changing GeoLocation test app hangs or not
testcase.summary: To Check test app hangs or not using changing GeoLocation
testcase.preconditions: Install app on devices or system

step.actions:
1. Launch the test app
2. Start the test
3. LoadAd
4. PlayAd
5. Goto location setting and
6. Try both Location "on" and "off", and then run the QA Test apps
7. Run an Ad, and then check to see if the Test app hangs, or if Task Manager shows heavy disk or CPU usage after a minute or two.

Also check following messages in Event Viewer
1. To get to "Location Settings", type "Location" in the search bar ("Type here to search"), and then click on "location privacy settings".

2.To run Task Manager, hold down Ctrl+Alt+Delete and choose "Task Manager", and then click on "Perfomance" or "Details" to watch CPU or disk usage.

3.Also, check the Event Viewer (in an explorer window, right-click on “This PC”, click on “Manage”, “Event Viewer”, “Application”), and check for Errors that look like the following (I’ve bolded the important parts):
*Summary*
*WindowsNonFatalSuspectedDeadlock*
Date
‎12/‎15/‎2017 9:30 PM
Status
Report sent
Problem signature
Problem Event Name: *WindowsNonFatalSuspectedDeadlock*
Version: 2
AppName: Unknown
FaultingModule: Geolocation.dll
InternalComponentId: *GetGeopositionOperationImpl*
DeadlockTimeoutMs: 420000
OriginatingCodeHint: Windows::Devices::Geolocation:: *GetGeopositionOperationImpl::InitializeAndStart*
OS Version: 10.0.16299.2.0.0.768.101
Locale ID: 1033
Extra information about the problem
Bucket ID: b903f13bfce510faf0ee362f905bee82 (127983441306)
step.expectedresults: After changing Geolocation test app should not hang and should not displayed error message in *Event viewer*

testcase.name: Windows SDK does not crash when server is in debug mode.
testcase.summary: To check Windows SDK does not crash when server is in debug mode.
testcase.preconditions: Install app on devices or system

step.actions:
1. Launch the test app
2. Load and play some ads
3. To check in Fiddler/ Charles to make sure that Request Headers do not contain the following Headers:
Vungle-Explain: true
X-JAEGER: stage
4.  Try turning these checkboxes on and off,
5. Repeat step 2
step.expectedresults:
1. Windows SDK should not crash

2. Vungle-Explain: true
     X-JAEGER: stage

Checkboxes on and off, and then making sure that these headers should display (if checked) or not (if not checked).

3.Test app functions should working appropriately, showing Ads, end cards, etc. also new headers don't break anything.

testcase.name: Test App for testing Sleep Codes
testcase.summary: To check Sleep Codes in Test App
testcase.preconditions: Install app on device or system

step.actions:
1. Launch Test App
2. Click on "Read Cached Ad Requests" and Observe ad request
3. Click on "Clear Cached Ad Requests" and observe ad request
step.expectedresults:
If you click on the "Read" button, it should tell you if there are any Ads for that placement ID, and tell you when it will sleep until.
 If you click on the "Clear" button, this request should be cleared from the database, and you should be able to attempt to read another AD – that is, you should see a request in Fiddler for the /ad, whereas if the database contains a request with a sleep code

"request":{
"placement_reference_id":"REWARDE78811",

"app_id":"$0$

{\"app_id\":\"5a57e2c45ccf1f44250129b8\",\"eventID\":\"5a6bbff587cf640be35187d1\"}
",

testcase.name: Correct behavior for OnAdPlayableChanged
testcase.summary: To check Correct behavior for OnAdPlayableChanged
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install Test App on device or System

step.actions:
1. Launch the test app
2. Start the test
3. LoadAd
4. PlayAd
5. Check logs

or 

1.) Delete all old files C:\Users\<user name>\AppData\Local\Packages\<vungle test app guid>\LocalState\VungleSDK

2) To find your app guid, try this from a command prompt:
cd c:\users\<user name>\AppData\Local\Packages
dir VungleSDK /s /p

3) You will want to try tests after deleting these files, and also after allowing these files to be cached.

4) Under "Options" set the placement to an Ad which should be cached, but which you know will not be available.
5) Check logs for message
6) Do the same for an Ad which should not be cached. Check logs for message described above.
step.expectedresults:
"Playable" should reflect the correct value in Logs. i.e.
14/Feb 17:54:56.658 Trace MainPageLogic AdPlayableEventArgs Placement: EXPECTT90562; Playable: False
or 14/Feb 17:54:56.658 Trace MainPageLogic AdPlayableEventArgs Placement: EXPECTT90562; Playable: True

testcase.name: Verify Consent message version for Legacy/MraidAd.
testcase.summary: Verify Consent message version for Legacy/MraidAd.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.

2. Initialize the app.

step.actions:
1. Initialize the app.

2. Tap on 3 dot drop down menu on upper right corner.

3. Tap on Update Consent.

4. Enter/Update consent version and tap on Yes/No button.

5. Load any play Ad.

6. Verify Consent message verion in request payload of Ads, ReportAd API.
step.expectedresults:
request payload of Ads, reportAd should contain following in GDPR.

"gdpr": {
"consent_status": "opted_in",
"consent_source": "publisher",
"consent_timestamp": 1533898828,
"consent_message_version": "1.4"
}

testcase.name: Close button behavior for MRAID video
testcase.summary: Based on "INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" and "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" parameter value, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions:
1. Set Charles proxy.
  2. Initialise the App 
  3. play ad
  4. Observe the Charles.

step.actions: 1)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5", 2)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", 3)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", set thees value in Ads response API
step.expectedresults: 1) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is 5. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button. 2) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is skippable close button; otherwise, it should delay for 5 seconds. 3) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is 9999 which is skippable close button.. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button.
